summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2015 HONDA ACCORD. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE HIS WIFE WAS REVERSING DOWN THE DRIVEWAY, THE VEHICLE LOSS POWER STEERING. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO OCEAN HONDA OF WEYMOUTH (211 MAIN ST, WEYMOUTH, MA 02188) AND DIAGNOSED AS A TORQUE SENSOR FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED HOWEVER, THE FAILURE RECURRED AFTER 31 MILES, WHILE ATTEMPTING TO MOVE FROM THE DRIVEWAY. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED BACK TO THE SAME DEALER. THE DEALER INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THEY WOULD PERFORM THE SAME REPAIR HOWEVER, THERE WAS NO GUARANTEE THAT THE FAILURE WOULD NOT RETURN. THE CONTACT PICKED UP THE VEHICLE AND TOOK IT TO PRIME HONDA - BOSTON (1575 VFW PKWY, WEST ROXBURY, MA 02132) WHERE IT WAS DIAGNOSED AS TORQUE SENSOR FAILURE. ADDITIONALLY, THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT RODENTS HAD EATEN THE WIRING HARNESS. THE VEHICLE WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THE VEHICLE WAS OVER THE WARRANTY COVERAGE. THE MANUFACTURER PROVIDED NO FURTHER ASSISTANCE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 29,000.
